alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 7:32PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Marshall and southwestern Jackson Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 729 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Scottsboro, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Locally heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...1 to 3 inches of rain has fallen in the last hour northewst of the Langston community in extreme northeastern Marshall county. Ponding of water on area roadways and localized flooding is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsboro, Section, Dutton, Langston, Larkinsville and Lim Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
